description: {"blocks":[{"key":"87f96","text":"This is the \"quick\" version of Monarch® PCR \u0026 DNA Cleanup Kit (5 μg) Protocol (NEB #T1030) DNA Cleanup and Concentration. For the full protocol, please click here.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":158,"length":4}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"D2C3021CD88149EB8BE150D953F12E60","url":"https://www.neb.com/protocols/2015/11/23/monarch-pcr-and-dna-cleanup-kit-protocol"}}}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"fkac8","text":"For detailed protocol and more information, visit www.neb.com/T1030","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":50,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":50,"length":17}],"data":{}},{"key":"cf9kr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"56n9s","text":"The full protocol is available here.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":31,"length":5}],"data":{}},{"key":"80iiu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2st05","text":"The video protocol is available here.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":32,"length":4}],"data":{}},{"key":"8smc0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eigbr","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cf66k","text":"There are two protocols available for this product:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cvl24","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9bdrb","text":"DNA Cleanup and Concentration (below): for the purification of up to   of DNA (ssDNA \u003e 200 nt and dsDNA \u003e 50 bp) from PCR and other enzymatic reactions.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":38},{"style":"bold","offset":63,"length":5},{"style":"bold","offset":74,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":69,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fart9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"31nma","text":"Oligonucleotide Cleanup: for the purification of up to   of DNA fragments ≥ 15 bp (dsDNA) or ≥ 18 nt (ssDNA). Expected recovery is \u003e 70%. When purifying ssDNA of any size, recovery can be increased by using this protocol; however, it is important to note that this protocol shifts the cutoff for smaller fragments to 18 nt (rather than 50 nt for the DNA Cleanup and Concentration Protocol). A detailed protocol and quick protocol are available for your convenience.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":24},{"style":"bold","offset":49,"length":5},{"style":"bold","offset":60,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[{"key":4,"offset":55,"length":1},{"key":5,"offset":393,"length":17},{"key":6,"offset":415,"length":14}],"data":{}},{"key":"dlrqo","text":"A step-by-step protocol is available here.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":7,"offset":37,"length":4}],"data":{}},{"key":"fbi87","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"B82D56D7FFB34C58B0745E8D099D1AFB","url":"https://www.neb.com/products/t1030-monarch-pcr-dna-cleanup-kit-5-ug"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"5B324814C7194BD9BB67F3DC81F6D8CA","url":"https://www.neb.com/protocols/2015/11/23/monarch-pcr-and-dna-cleanup-kit-protocol"}},"2":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"267B1E7190414505943F98EAD8EBA813","url":"https://www.neb.com/tools-and-resources/video-library?videoid=%7B0d9e96c2-2bfa-47a7-babc-b5e584213db7%7D"}},"3":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"5","guid":"73410C20A8F811EAA4DC2972ED4BECEC","id":0,"label":"","unit":4}},"4":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"5","guid":"7F760C20A8F811EAA4DC2972ED4BECEC","id":0,"label":"","unit":4}},"5":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"64A960D72BFE45E3AB0A4AA6C935ABBF","url":"https://www.neb.com/protocols/2017/04/25/oligonucleotide-cleanup-using-monarch-pcr-dna-cleanup-kit-5-g-protocol-neb-t1030"}},"6":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"F510CDC3190D4ABFAE7DA74A13D1845C","url":"https://www.neb.com/protocols/2017/04/25/quick-protocol-for-oligonucleotide-cleanup-using-the-monarch-pcr-dna-cleanup-kit-5-g-neb-t1030"}},"7":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"A702B630A8F811EAA4DC2972ED4BECEC","url":"https://www.protocols.io/private/79B53FBA54C51DC3C33A7D01D53CBD7F"}}}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"csfml","text":"Dilute sample with DNA Cleanup Binding Buffer according to the table below. Mix well by pipetting up and down or flicking the tube. Do not vortex.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2fdbs","text":"   Sample Type Ratio of Binding Buffer: Sample Example   dsDNA \u003e 2 kb (plasmids, gDNA) 2:1 200 μl: 100 μl   dsDNA \u003c 2 kb (some amplicons,  fragments) 5:1 500 μl: 100 μl   ssDNA \u003e 200 nt* 7:1 700 μl: 100 μl   ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":3,"length":11},{"style":"bold","offset":15,"length":31},{"style":"bold","offset":47,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":208}],"data":{}},{"key":"6mttu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3o1ct","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"","data":{"cellsMeta":{"A_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"B_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"C_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"}},"colTitles":["","",""],"colWidths":[275,"226","163"],"data":[["\u003cstrong\u003eSample\u0026nbsp;Type\u003c/strong\u003e","\u003cstrong\u003eRatio of Binding Buffer: Sample\u003c/strong\u003e","\u003cstrong\u003eExample\u003c/strong\u003e"],["dsDNA \u0026gt; 2 kb\u0026nbsp;(plasmids, gDNA)","2:1","200 μl: 100 μl"],["dsDNA \u0026lt; 2 kb (some amplicons, \u0026nbsp;fragments)","5:1","500 μl: 100 μl"],["ssDNA\u0026nbsp;\u0026gt; 200 nt*","7:1","700 μl: 100 μl"]],"guid":"BAC202F0B72511E88916D1DB482D0BED","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":32,"offset":76}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"74fah","text":"*Please note that recovery of ssDNA \u003c 200 nts can be increased by using the Oligonucleotide Cleanup Protocol, but doing so will shift the cutoff size for DNA binding to 18 nt (versus 50 nt).","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"guid":"DAB891CEA8F811EA8CB20A58A9FEAC2A","url":"https://www.neb.com/protocols/2017/04/25/oligonucleotide-cleanup-using-monarch-pcr-dna-cleanup-kit-5-g-protocol-neb-t1030"},"type":"link"}}},"mergeCells":{},"printData":[["\u003cstrong\u003eSample\u0026nbsp;Type\u003c/strong\u003e","\u003cstrong\u003eRatio of Binding Buffer: Sample\u003c/strong\u003e","\u003cstrong\u003eExample\u003c/strong\u003e"],["dsDNA \u0026gt; 2 kb\u0026nbsp;(plasmids, gDNA)","2:1","200 μl: 100 μl"],["dsDNA \u0026lt; 2 kb (some amplicons, \u0026nbsp;fragments)","5:1","500 μl: 100 μl"],["ssDNA\u0026nbsp;\u0026gt; 200 nt*","7:1","700 μl: 100 μl"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23],"show_headers":true}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ed1pp","text":"A sample volume of 20–100 μl is recommended. For smaller samples, TE can be used to adjust the volume. For diluted samples larger than 800 μl, load a portion of the sample, proceed with step 2, and then repeat as necessary.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1ltri","text":"Spin for   to elute DNA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":9,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ftrgc","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":60,"guid":"466E0580A8F911EAA4DC2972ED4BECEC","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":28},{"key":1,"length":1,"offset":30},{"key":2,"length":1,"offset":277}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1gvag","text":"Typical elution volumes are  – . Nuclease-free water (pH 7–8.5) can also be used to elute the DNA. Yield may slightly increase if a larger volume of DNA Elution Buffer is used, but the DNA will be less concentrated. For larger size DNA (≥ 10 kb), heating the elution buffer to   prior to use can improve yield. Care should be used to ensure the elution buffer is delivered onto the matrix and not the wall of the column to maximize elution efficiency.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"amount":"6","guid":"4A33C010A8F911EAA4DC2972ED4BECEC","id":0,"label":"","unit":1},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"amount"},"1":{"data":{"amount":"20","guid":"4C1BB9F0A8F911EAA4DC2972ED4BECEC","id":0,"label":"","unit":1},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"amount"},"2":{"data":{"guid":"52681F60A8F911EAA4DC2972ED4BECEC","id":0,"label":"","temperature":"50","unit":10},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"temperature"}}}}}}
